ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 30
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, here s a tidbit about making bows that I discovered the hard way (by trying it out).  At skill 170, bows made with Oak, a plane, silk, and 1 cam, are
ygData.messageBody:
Well, here's a tidbit about making bows that I discovered the hard way (by
trying it out). At skill 170, bows made with Oak, a plane, silk, and 1 cam,
are trivial. I suspect that the 2 cam is also but I haven't tried it (had a
customer ask for the 1 cam). Anyone have any idea when (or IF) darkwood
becomes trivial? Man, would I laugh hard if I threw a darkwood in with 2
cams, some silk and a planing tool and get the trivial message (yeah, I
know, I'm dreaming). Anyone have any experience with this? Anyone had any
spectacular failures working with Darkwood? Anyone know how (or if) cams
and planing tools increase the level needed to make a bow (or at which it is
trivial)? How about pricing? I've been selling the basic Rough Oak recurve
bow (hemp string) for 150pp and have sold quite a few. I sold one 1-cam Oak
recurve for 200pp. Am I charging too little? Too much? What would you
sell a darkwood for?
